main_definition: To do something in a hurried or frantic manner, often due to urgency or desire.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move quickly towards a destination
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to rush to catch the last bus.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Feeling a sense of urgency or panic
meanings_and_examples.example: After hearing the news, he was in a complete rush to leave his house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To work with great enthusiasm and speed
meanings_and_examples.example: The team put all their energy into completing the project before the deadline, working non-stop in a rush.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be very excited about an upcoming event or happening
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm going to my cousin's wedding next month and I can hardly contain my excitement. I'm totally in a rush!

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sudden surge of people or things
meanings_and_examples.example: The crowd began to rush towards the stage as soon as the doors opened.
